        <a href="/wiki/File:Brigadeiro.jpg" class="image"><img alt="" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/a/a4/Brigadeiro.jpg/220px-Brigadeiro.jpg" decoding="async" width="220" height="165" class="thumbimage" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/a/a4/Brigadeiro.jpg/330px-Brigadeiro.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/a/a4/Brigadeiro.jpg/440px-Brigadeiro.jpg 2x" data-file-width="2272" data-file-height="1704"></a> 
        <div class="thumbcaption">
         <div class="magnify">
          <a href="/wiki/File:Brigadeiro.jpg" class="internal" title="Enlarge"></a>
         </div><a href="/wiki/Brigadeiro" title="Brigadeiro">Brigadeiro</a> is recognized as one of the main dishes of <a href="/wiki/Brazilian_cuisine" title="Brazilian cuisine">Brazilian cuisine</a>
        </div>
       </div>
      </div> 
      <p>Brazilian cuisine varies greatly by region, reflecting the country's varying mix of indigenous and immigrant populations. This has created a national cuisine marked by the preservation of regional differences.<sup id="cite_ref-Encarta_4_564-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Encarta_4-564">[559]</a></sup> Examples are <a href="/wiki/Feijoada" title="Feijoada">feijoada</a>, considered the country's national dish;<sup id="cite_ref-565" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-565">[560]</a></sup> and regional foods such as beiju, feijão tropeiro, <a href="/wiki/Vatap%C3%A1" title="Vatapá">vatapá</a>, <a href="/wiki/Moqueca" title="Moqueca">moqueca</a>, <a href="/wiki/Polenta" title="Polenta">polenta</a> (from Italian cuisine) and <a href="/wiki/Acaraj%C3%A9" class="mw-redirect" title="Acarajé">acarajé</a> (from African cuisine).<sup id="cite_ref-566" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-566">[561]</a></sup> </p>
      <p>The national beverage is coffee and <a href="/wiki/Cacha%C3%A7a" title="Cachaça">cachaça</a> is Brazil's native <a href="/wiki/Distilled_beverage" class="mw-redirect" title="Distilled beverage">liquor</a>. Cachaça is distilled from <a href="/wiki/Sugarcane" title="Sugarcane">sugar cane</a> and is the main ingredient in the national cocktail, <a href="/wiki/Caipirinha" title="Caipirinha">caipirinha</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-Bayor2011_567-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Bayor2011-567">[562]</a></sup> </p>
      <p>A typical meal consists mostly of <a href="/wiki/Rice_and_beans" title="Rice and beans">rice and beans</a> with beef, salad, french fries and a <a href="/wiki/Fried_egg" title="Fried egg">fried egg</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-568" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-568">[563]</a></sup> Often, it is mixed with cassava flour (<a href="/wiki/Farofa" title="Farofa">farofa</a>). Fried potatoes, fried cassava, fried banana, fried meat and fried cheese are very often eaten in lunch and served in most typical restaurants.<sup id="cite_ref-569" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-569">[564]</a></sup> Popular snacks are <a href="/wiki/Pastel_(food)" title="Pastel (food)">pastel</a> (a fried pastry); <a href="/wiki/Coxinha" title="Coxinha">coxinha</a> (a variation of chicken croquete); <a href="/wiki/P%C3%A3o_de_queijo" title="Pão de queijo">pão de queijo</a> (cheese bread and cassava flour / <a href="/wiki/Tapioca" title="Tapioca">tapioca</a>); <a href="/wiki/Pamonha" title="Pamonha">pamonha</a> (corn and milk paste); <a href="/wiki/Sfiha" title="Sfiha">esfirra</a> (a variation of Lebanese pastry); <a href="/wiki/Kibbeh" title="Kibbeh">kibbeh</a> (from Arabic cuisine); <a href="/wiki/Empanada" title="Empanada">empanada</a> (pastry) and <a href="/wiki/Empada" class="mw-redirect" title="Empada">empada</a>, little salt pies filled with shrimps or heart of palm. </p>
      <p>Brazil has a variety of desserts such as <a href="/wiki/Brigadeiro" title="Brigadeiro">brigadeiros</a> (chocolate fudge balls), <a href="/wiki/Bolo_de_rolo" title="Bolo de rolo">bolo de rolo</a> (roll cake with <a href="/wiki/Goiabada" title="Goiabada">goiabada</a>), <a href="/wiki/Cocada" title="Cocada">cocada</a> (a coconut sweet), <a href="/wiki/Beijinho" title="Beijinho">beijinhos</a> (coconut truffles and clove) and romeu e julieta (cheese with goiabada). Peanuts are used to make <a href="/wiki/Pa%C3%A7oca" title="Paçoca">paçoca</a>, <a href="/wiki/Rapadura" class="mw-redirect" title="Rapadura">rapadura</a> and <a href="/wiki/P%C3%A9-de-moleque" title="Pé-de-moleque">pé-de-moleque</a>. Local common fruits like <a href="/wiki/A%C3%A7a%C3%AD" class="mw-redirect" title="Açaí">açaí</a>, <a href="/wiki/Cupua%C3%A7u" class="mw-redirect" title="Cupuaçu">cupuaçu</a>, mango, papaya, <a href="/wiki/Cocoa_bean" title="Cocoa bean">cocoa</a>, <a href="/wiki/Cashew" title="Cashew">cashew</a>, <a href="/wiki/Guava" title="Guava">guava</a>, orange, <a href="/wiki/Lime_(fruit)" title="Lime (fruit)">lime</a>, <a href="/wiki/Passionfruit" class="mw-redirect" title="Passionfruit">passionfruit</a>, pineapple, and <a href="/wiki/Spondias" title="Spondias">hog plum</a> are turned in juices and used to make chocolates, <a href="/wiki/Ice_pop" title="Ice pop">ice pops</a> and ice cream.<sup id="cite_ref-570" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-570">[565]</a></sup> </p> 
      <h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Cinema">Cinema</span></h3> 
      <div role="note" class="hatnote navigation-not-searchable">
       Main article: <a href="/wiki/Cinema_of_Brazil" title="Cinema of Brazil">Cinema of Brazil</a>
      </div> 
      <link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r978413945/mw-parser-output/.tmulti">
      <div class="thumb tmulti tright">
       <div class="thumbinner" style="width:224px;max-width:224px">
        <div class="trow">
         <div class="tsingle" style="width:222px;max-width:222px">
          <div class="thumbimage">
           <a href="/wiki/File:Palacio_festivais.jpg" class="image"><img alt="" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/3/35/Palacio_festivais.jpg/220px-Palacio_festivais.jpg" decoding="async" width="220" height="147" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/3/35/Palacio_festivais.jpg/330px-Palacio_festivais.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/3/35/Palacio_festivais.jpg/440px-Palacio_festivais.jpg 2x" data-file-width="500" data-file-height="334"></a>
          </div>
          <div class="thumbcaption">
           <a href="/wiki/Festival_de_Gramado" title="Festival de Gramado">Festival de Gramado</a>, the biggest <a href="/wiki/Film_festival" title="Film festival">film festival</a> in the country
          </div>
         </div>
        </div>
        <div class="trow">
         <div class="tsingle" style="width:222px;max-width:222px">
          <div class="thumbimage">
           <a href="/wiki/File:Fernando_Meirelles_-_%C3%96sterreichpremiere_360_Wiener_Volkstheater_01.jpg" class="image"><img alt="" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/9/92/Fernando_Meirelles_-_%C3%96sterreichpremiere_360_Wiener_Volkstheater_01.jpg/220px-Fernando_Meirelles_-_%C3%96sterreichpremiere_360_Wiener_Volkstheater_01.jpg" decoding="async" width="220" height="147" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/9/92/Fernando_Meirelles_-_%C3%96sterreichpremiere_360_Wiener_Volkstheater_01.jpg/330px-Fernando_Meirelles_-_%C3%96sterreichpremiere_360_Wiener_Volkstheater_01.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/9/92/Fernando_Meirelles_-_%C3%96sterreichpremiere_360_Wiener_Volkstheater_01.jpg/440px-Fernando_Meirelles_-_%C3%96sterreichpremiere_360_Wiener_Volkstheater_01.jpg 2x" data-file-width="1094" data-file-height="729"></a>
          </div>
          <div class="thumbcaption">
           <a href="/wiki/Fernando_Meirelles" title="Fernando Meirelles">Fernando Meirelles</a>, who was nominated for the <a href="/wiki/Academy_Award_for_Best_Director" title="Academy Award for Best Director">Academy Award for Best Director</a> for <i><a href="/wiki/City_of_God_(2002_film)" title="City of God (2002 film)">City of God</a></i>
          </div>
         </div>
        </div>
       </div>
      </div> 
      <p>The Brazilian film industry began in the late 19th century, during the early days of the <a href="/wiki/Belle_%C3%89poque" title="Belle Époque">Belle Époque</a>. While there were national film productions during the early 20th century, American films such as <i>Rio the Magnificent</i> were made in <a href="/wiki/Rio_de_Janeiro" title="Rio de Janeiro">Rio de Janeiro</a> to promote tourism in the city.<sup id="cite_ref-571" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-571">[566]</a></sup> The films <i><a href="/wiki/Limite" title="Limite">Limite</a></i> (1931) and <i><a href="/wiki/Ganga_Bruta" title="Ganga Bruta">Ganga Bruta</a></i> (1933), the latter being produced by <a href="/wiki/Adhemar_Gonzaga" title="Adhemar Gonzaga">Adhemar Gonzaga</a> through the prolific studio Cinédia, were poorly received at release and failed at the box office, but are acclaimed nowadays and placed among the finest Brazilian films of all time.<sup id="cite_ref-572" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-572">[567]</a></sup> The 1941 unfinished film <i><a href="/wiki/It%27s_All_True_(film)" title="It's All True (film)">It's All True</a></i> was divided in four segments, two of which were filmed in Brazil and directed by <a href="/wiki/Orson_Welles" title="Orson Welles">Orson Welles</a>; it was originally produced as part of the United States' <a href="/wiki/Good_Neighbor_Policy" class="mw-redirect" title="Good Neighbor Policy">Good Neighbor Policy</a> during Getúlio Vargas' Estado Novo government. </p>
      <p>During the 1960s, the <a href="/wiki/Cinema_Novo" title="Cinema Novo">Cinema Novo</a> movement rose to prominence with directors such as <a href="/wiki/Glauber_Rocha" title="Glauber Rocha">Glauber Rocha</a>, <a href="/wiki/Nelson_Pereira_dos_Santos" title="Nelson Pereira dos Santos">Nelson Pereira dos Santos</a>, <a href="/wiki/Paulo_C%C3%A9sar_Saraceni" title="Paulo César Saraceni">Paulo César Saraceni</a> and <a href="/wiki/Arnaldo_Jabor" title="Arnaldo Jabor">Arnaldo Jabor</a>. Rocha's films <i><a href="/wiki/Deus_e_o_Diabo_na_Terra_do_Sol" class="mw-redirect" title="Deus e o Diabo na Terra do Sol">Deus e o Diabo na Terra do Sol</a></i> (1964) and <i><a href="/wiki/Terra_em_Transe" class="mw-redirect" title="Terra em Transe">Terra em Transe</a></i> (1967) are considered to be some of the greatest and most influential in Brazilian film history.<sup id="cite_ref-573" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-573">[568]</a></sup> </p>
      <p>During the 1990s, Brazil saw a surge of critical and commercial success with films such as <i><a href="/wiki/O_Quatrilho" title="O Quatrilho">O Quatrilho</a></i> (<a href="/wiki/F%C3%A1bio_Barreto" title="Fábio Barreto">Fábio Barreto</a>, 1995), <i><a href="/wiki/O_Que_%C3%89_Isso,_Companheiro%3F" class="mw-redirect" title="O Que É Isso, Companheiro?">O Que É Isso, Companheiro?</a></i> (<a href="/wiki/Bruno_Barreto" title="Bruno Barreto">Bruno Barreto</a>, 1997) and <i><a href="/wiki/Central_Station_(film)" title="Central Station (film)">Central do Brasil</a></i> (<a href="/wiki/Walter_Salles" title="Walter Salles">Walter Salles</a>, 1998), all of which were nominated for the <a href="/wiki/Academy_Award_for_Best_Foreign_Language_Film" class="mw-redirect" title="Academy Award for Best Foreign Language Film">Academy Award for Best Foreign Language Film</a>, the latter receiving a <a href="/wiki/Academy_Award_for_Best_Actress" title="Academy Award for Best Actress">Best Actress</a> nomination for <a href="/wiki/Fernanda_Montenegro" title="Fernanda Montenegro">Fernanda Montenegro</a>. The 2002 crime film <i><a href="/wiki/City_of_God_(2002_film)" title="City of God (2002 film)">City of God</a></i>, directed by <a href="/wiki/Fernando_Meirelles" title="Fernando Meirelles">Fernando Meirelles</a>, was critically acclaimed, scoring 90% on <a href="/wiki/Rotten_Tomatoes" title="Rotten Tomatoes">Rotten Tomatoes</a>,<sup id="cite_ref-574" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-574">[569]</a></sup> being placed in <a href="/wiki/Roger_Ebert" title="Roger Ebert">Roger Ebert</a>'s Best Films of the Decade list<sup id="cite_ref-575" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-575">[570]</a></sup> and receiving four <a href="/wiki/Academy_Awards" title="Academy Awards">Academy Award</a> nominations in 2004, including <a href="/wiki/Academy_Award_for_Best_Director" title="Academy Award for Best Director">Best Director</a>. Notable film festivals in Brazil include the <a href="/wiki/S%C3%A3o_Paulo_International_Film_Festival" title="São Paulo International Film Festival">São Paulo</a> and <a href="/wiki/Rio_de_Janeiro_International_Film_Festival" title="Rio de Janeiro International Film Festival">Rio de Janeiro International Film Festivals</a> and the <a href="/wiki/Festival_de_Gramado" title="Festival de Gramado">Gramado Festival</a>. </p> 
      <h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Theatre">Theatre</span></h3> 
      <div class="thumb tright">
       <div class="thumbinner" style="width:222px;">
        <a href="/wiki/File:Teatro_Municipal_de_S%C3%A3o_Paulo_8.jpg" class="image"><img alt="" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/b/bc/Teatro_Municipal_de_S%C3%A3o_Paulo_8.jpg/220px-Teatro_Municipal_de_S%C3%A3o_Paulo_8.jpg" decoding="async" width="220" height="141" class="thumbimage" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/b/bc/Teatro_Municipal_de_S%C3%A3o_Paulo_8.jpg/330px-Teatro_Municipal_de_S%C3%A3o_Paulo_8.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/b/bc/Teatro_Municipal_de_S%C3%A3o_Paulo_8.jpg/440px-Teatro_Municipal_de_S%C3%A3o_Paulo_8.jpg 2x" data-file-width="11224" data-file-height="7210"></a> 
        <div class="thumbcaption">
         <div class="magnify">
          <a href="/wiki/File:Teatro_Municipal_de_S%C3%A3o_Paulo_8.jpg" class="internal" title="Enlarge"></a>
         </div><a href="/wiki/Theatro_Municipal_(S%C3%A3o_Paulo)" title="Theatro Municipal (São Paulo)">São Paulo Municipal Theater</a>, significant for its architectural value and its <a href="/wiki/Modern_Art_Week" title="Modern Art Week">historical importance</a>
        </div>
       </div>
      </div> 
      <div class="thumb tright">
       <div class="thumbinner" style="width:222px;">
        <a href="/wiki/File:Teatro_Amazonas.jpg" class="image"><img alt="" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/6/6a/Teatro_Amazonas.jpg/220px-Teatro_Amazonas.jpg" decoding="async" width="220" height="165" class="thumbimage" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/6/6a/Teatro_Amazonas.jpg/330px-Teatro_Amazonas.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/6/6a/Teatro_Amazonas.jpg/440px-Teatro_Amazonas.jpg 2x" data-file-width="1693" data-file-height="1270"></a> 
        <div class="thumbcaption">
         <div class="magnify">
          <a href="/wiki/File:Teatro_Amazonas.jpg" class="internal" title="Enlarge"></a>
         </div>Interior of the <a href="/wiki/Amazon_Theatre" title="Amazon Theatre">Teatro Amazonas</a>, in <a href="/wiki/Manaus" title="Manaus">Manaus</a>
        </div>
       </div>
      </div> 
      <p>The theatre in Brazil has its origins in the period of Jesuit expansion when theater was used for the dissemination of Catholic doctrine in the 16th century. in the 17th and 18th centuries the first dramatists who appeared on the scene of European derivation was for court or private performances.<sup id="cite_ref-576" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-576">[571]</a></sup> During the 19th century, dramatic theater gained importance and thickness,<sup class="noprint Inline-Template" style="margin-left:0.1em; white-space:nowrap;">[<i><a href="/wiki/Wikipedia:Please_clarify" title="Wikipedia:Please clarify"><span title="&quot;thickness&quot;? Perhaps this means &quot;popularity&quot;? (February 2021)">clarification needed</span></a></i>]</sup> whose first representative was <a href="/wiki/Lu%C3%ADs_Carlos_Martins_Pena" class="mw-redirect" title="Luís Carlos Martins Pena">Luís Carlos Martins Pena</a> (1813–1848), capable of describing contemporary reality. Always in this period the comedy of costume and comic production was imposed.<sup class="noprint Inline-Template" style="margin-left:0.1em; white-space:nowrap;">[<i><a href="/wiki/Wikipedia:Please_clarify" title="Wikipedia:Please clarify"><span title="should &quot;imposed&quot; be &quot;imported&quot;? (February 2021)">clarification needed</span></a></i>]</sup> Significant, also in the nineteenth century, was also the playwright <a href="/wiki/Ant%C3%B4nio_Gon%C3%A7alves_Dias" class="mw-redirect" title="Antônio Gonçalves Dias">Antônio Gonçalves Dias</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-teatro_577-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-teatro-577">[572]</a></sup> There were also numerous operas and orchestras. The Brazilian conductor <a href="/wiki/Ant%C3%B4nio_Carlos_Gomes" title="Antônio Carlos Gomes">Antônio Carlos Gomes</a> became internationally known with operas like <i><a href="/wiki/Il_Guarany" title="Il Guarany">Il Guarany</a></i>. At the end of the 19th century orchestrated <a href="/wiki/Dramaturge" title="Dramaturge">dramaturgias</a> became very popular and were accompanied with songs of famous artists like the conductress <a href="/wiki/Chiquinha_Gonzaga" title="Chiquinha Gonzaga">Chiquinha Gonzaga</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-578" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-578">[573]</a></sup> </p>
      <p>Already in the early 20th century there was the presence of theaters, entrepreneurs and actor companies, but paradoxically the quality of the products staggered, and only in 1940 the Brazilian theater received a boost of renewal thanks to the action of Paschoal Carlos Magno and his student's theater, the comedians group and the Italian actors <a href="/wiki/Adolfo_Celi" title="Adolfo Celi">Adolfo Celi</a>, Ruggero Jacobbi and Aldo Calvo, founders of the <i>Teatro Brasileiro de Comedia</i>. From the 1960s it was attended by a theater dedicated to social and religious issues and to the flourishing of schools of dramatic art. The most prominent authors at this stage were <a href="/wiki/Jorge_Andrade" title="Jorge Andrade">Jorge Andrade</a> and <a href="/wiki/Ariano_Suassuna" title="Ariano Suassuna">Ariano Suassuna</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-teatro_577-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-teatro-577">[572]</a></sup> </p> 
      <h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Visual_arts">Visual arts</span></h3> 
      <div role="note" class="hatnote navigation-not-searchable">
       Main article: <a href="/wiki/Brazilian_painting" title="Brazilian painting">Brazilian painting</a>
      </div> 
      <link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r978413945/mw-parser-output/.tmulti">
      <div class="thumb tmulti tright">
       <div class="thumbinner" style="width:358px;max-width:358px">
        <div class="trow">
         <div class="tsingle" style="width:152px;max-width:152px">
          <div class="thumbimage">
           <a href="/wiki/File:Americo-noite.jpg" class="image"><img alt="" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/9/97/Americo-noite.jpg/150px-Americo-noite.jpg" decoding="async" width="150" height="202" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/9/97/Americo-noite.jpg/225px-Americo-noite.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/9/97/Americo-noite.jpg/300px-Americo-noite.jpg 2x" data-file-width="743" data-file-height="1000"></a>
          </div>
          <div class="thumbcaption">
           <i>The Night escorted by the geniuses of Love and Study</i>, by <a href="/wiki/Pedro_Am%C3%A9rico" title="Pedro Américo">Pedro Américo</a>
          </div>
         </div>
         <div class="tsingle" style="width:202px;max-width:202px">
          <div class="thumbimage">
           <a href="/wiki/File:Discovery_of_the_Land1.jpg" class="image"><img alt="" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/4/40/Discovery_of_the_Land1.jpg/200px-Discovery_of_the_Land1.jpg" decoding="async" width="200" height="203" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/4/40/Discovery_of_the_Land1.jpg/300px-Discovery_of_the_Land1.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/4/40/Discovery_of_the_Land1.jpg/400px-Discovery_of_the_Land1.jpg 2x" data-file-width="2901" data-file-height="2939"></a>
          </div>
          <div class="thumbcaption">
           <i>Discovery of the Land</i> mural, by Brazilian painter <a href="/wiki/Candido_Portinari" title="Candido Portinari">Candido Portinari</a>, at the <a href="/wiki/Library_of_Congress" title="Library of Congress">Library of Congress</a>
          </div>
         </div>
        </div>
       </div>
      </div> 
      <p>Brazilian painting emerged in the late 16th century,<sup id="cite_ref-579" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-579">[574]</a></sup> influenced by <a href="/wiki/Baroque" title="Baroque">Baroque</a>, <a href="/wiki/Rococo" title="Rococo">Rococo</a>, <a href="/wiki/Neoclassicism" title="Neoclassicism">Neoclassicism</a>, <a href="/wiki/Romanticism" title="Romanticism">Romanticism</a>, <a href="/wiki/Realism_(arts)" title="Realism (arts)">Realism</a>, <a href="/wiki/Modernism" title="Modernism">Modernism</a>, <a href="/wiki/Expressionism" title="Expressionism">Expressionism</a>, <a href="/wiki/Surrealism" title="Surrealism">Surrealism</a>, <a href="/wiki/Cubism" title="Cubism">Cubism</a> and <a href="/wiki/Abstract_art" title="Abstract art">Abstracionism</a> making it a major <a href="/wiki/Style_(visual_arts)" title="Style (visual arts)">art style</a> called <a href="/wiki/Brazilian_academic_art" title="Brazilian academic art">Brazilian academic art</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-580" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-580">[575]</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-Biscardi_581-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Biscardi-581">[576]</a></sup> The <a href="/wiki/Miss%C3%A3o_Art%C3%ADstica_Francesa" title="Missão Artística Francesa">Missão Artística Francesa</a> (French Artistic Mission) arrived in Brazil in 1816 proposing the creation of an art academy modeled after the respected Académie des Beaux-Arts, with graduation courses both for artists and craftsmen for activities such as modeling, decorating, carpentry and others and bringing artists like <a href="/wiki/Jean-Baptiste_Debret" title="Jean-Baptiste Debret">Jean-Baptiste Debret</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-Biscardi_581-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Biscardi-581">[576]</a></sup> </p>
      <p>Upon the creation of the <a href="/wiki/Academia_Imperial_de_Belas_Artes" class="mw-redirect" title="Academia Imperial de Belas Artes">Imperial Academy of Fine Arts</a>, new artistic movements spread across the country during the 19th century and later the event called <a href="/wiki/Week_of_Modern_Art" class="mw-redirect" title="Week of Modern Art">Week of Modern Art</a> broke definitely with academic tradition in 1922 and started a nationalist trend which was influenced by modernist arts. Among the best-known Brazilian painters are <a href="/wiki/Ricardo_do_Pilar" title="Ricardo do Pilar">Ricardo do Pilar</a> and <a href="/wiki/Manuel_da_Costa_Ata%C3%ADde" class="mw-redirect" title="Manuel da Costa Ataíde">Manuel da Costa Ataíde</a> (baroque and rococo), <a href="/wiki/Victor_Meirelles" title="Victor Meirelles">Victor Meirelles</a>, <a href="/wiki/Pedro_Am%C3%A9rico" title="Pedro Américo">Pedro Américo</a> and <a href="/wiki/Almeida_Junior" class="mw-redirect" title="Almeida Junior">Almeida Junior</a> (romanticism and realism), <a href="/wiki/Anita_Malfatti" title="Anita Malfatti">Anita Malfatti</a>, <a href="/wiki/Ismael_Nery" title="Ismael Nery">Ismael Nery</a>, <a href="/wiki/Lasar_Segall" title="Lasar Segall">Lasar Segall</a>, <a href="/wiki/Emiliano_di_Cavalcanti" class="mw-redirect" title="Emiliano di Cavalcanti">Emiliano di Cavalcanti</a>, <a href="/wiki/Vicente_do_Rego_Monteiro" title="Vicente do Rego Monteiro">Vicente do Rego Monteiro</a>, and <a href="/wiki/Tarsila_do_Amaral" title="Tarsila do Amaral">Tarsila do Amaral</a> (expressionism, surrealism and cubism), <a href="/wiki/Aldo_Bonadei" title="Aldo Bonadei">Aldo Bonadei</a>, <a href="/wiki/Jos%C3%A9_Pancetti" title="José Pancetti">José Pancetti</a> and <a href="/wiki/C%C3%A2ndido_Portinari" class="mw-redirect" title="Cândido Portinari">Cândido Portinari</a> (modernism).<sup id="cite_ref-582" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-582">[577]</a></sup> </p> 
      <h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Sports">Sports</span></h3> 
      <div role="note" class="hatnote navigation-not-searchable">
       Main article: <a href="/wiki/Sport_in_Brazil" title="Sport in Brazil">Sport in Brazil</a>
      </div> 
      <div class="thumb tright">
       <div class="thumbinner" style="width:222px;">
        <a href="/wiki/File:Terminam_os_Jogos_Ol%C3%ADmpicos_Rio_2016_(29040726262).jpg" class="image"><img alt="" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/d/de/Terminam_os_Jogos_Ol%C3%ADmpicos_Rio_2016_%2829040726262%29.jpg/220px-Terminam_os_Jogos_Ol%C3%ADmpicos_Rio_2016_%2829040726262%29.jpg" decoding="async" width="220" height="147" class="thumbimage" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/d/de/Terminam_os_Jogos_Ol%C3%ADmpicos_Rio_2016_%2829040726262%29.jpg/330px-Terminam_os_Jogos_Ol%C3%ADmpicos_Rio_2016_%2829040726262%29.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/d/de/Terminam_os_Jogos_Ol%C3%ADmpicos_Rio_2016_%2829040726262%29.jpg/440px-Terminam_os_Jogos_Ol%C3%ADmpicos_Rio_2016_%2829040726262%29.jpg 2x" data-file-width="3800" data-file-height="2533"></a> 
        <div class="thumbcaption">
         <div class="magnify">
          <a href="/wiki/File:Terminam_os_Jogos_Ol%C3%ADmpicos_Rio_2016_(29040726262).jpg" class="internal" title="Enlarge"></a>
         </div><a href="/wiki/2016_Summer_Olympics_closing_ceremony" title="2016 Summer Olympics closing ceremony">Closing ceremony</a> of the <a href="/wiki/2016_Summer_Olympics" title="2016 Summer Olympics">2016 Summer Olympics</a> at the <a href="/wiki/Maracan%C3%A3_Stadium" title="Maracanã Stadium">Maracanã Stadium</a>, <a href="/wiki/Rio_de_Janeiro" title="Rio de Janeiro">Rio de Janeiro</a>.
        </div>
       </div>
      </div> 
      <p>The most popular sport in Brazil is <a href="/wiki/Association_football" title="Association football">football</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-583" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-583">[578]</a></sup> The <a href="/wiki/Brazil_national_football_team" title="Brazil national football team">Brazilian men's national team</a> is ranked among the best in the world according to the <a href="/wiki/FIFA_World_Rankings" title="FIFA World Rankings">FIFA World Rankings</a>, and has won the <a href="/wiki/FIFA_World_Cup" title="FIFA World Cup">World Cup</a> tournament a record five times.<sup id="cite_ref-584" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-584">[579]</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-585" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-585">[580]</a></sup> </p>
      <p><a href="/wiki/Volleyball" title="Volleyball">Volleyball</a>, <a href="/wiki/Basketball" title="Basketball">basketball</a>, <a href="/wiki/Futsal" title="Futsal">futsal</a>, <a href="/wiki/Auto_racing" title="Auto racing">auto racing</a>, and <a href="/wiki/Martial_arts" title="Martial arts">martial arts</a> also attract large audiences.<sup id="cite_ref-586" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-586">[581]</a></sup> The <a href="/wiki/Brazil_men%27s_national_volleyball_team" title="Brazil men's national volleyball team">Brazil men's national volleyball team</a>, for example, currently<sup class="noprint Inline-Template" style="white-space:nowrap;">[<i><a href="/wiki/Wikipedia:Manual_of_Style/Dates_and_numbers#Chronological_items" title="Wikipedia:Manual of Style/Dates and numbers"><span title="The time period mentioned near this tag is ambiguous. (February 2021)">when?</span></a></i>]</sup> holds the titles of the <a href="/wiki/FIVB_Volleyball_World_League" title="FIVB Volleyball World League">World League</a>, <a href="/wiki/FIVB_Volleyball_World_Grand_Champions_Cup" title="FIVB Volleyball World Grand Champions Cup">World Grand Champions Cup</a>, <a href="/wiki/FIVB_Volleyball_Men%27s_World_Championship" title="FIVB Volleyball Men's World Championship">World Championship</a> and the <a href="/wiki/FIVB_Volleyball_Men%27s_World_Cup" title="FIVB Volleyball Men's World Cup">World Cup</a>. In auto racing, three Brazilian drivers have won the <a href="/wiki/Formula_One" title="Formula One">Formula One</a> world championship eight times.<sup id="cite_ref-587" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-587">[582]</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-588" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-588">[583]</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-589" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-589">[584]</a></sup> </p>
      <p>Some sport variations have their origins in Brazil: <a href="/wiki/Beach_soccer" title="Beach soccer">beach football</a>,<sup id="cite_ref-590" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-590">[585]</a></sup> <a href="/wiki/Futsal" title="Futsal">futsal</a> (indoor football)<sup id="cite_ref-591" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-591">[586]</a></sup> and <a href="/wiki/Footvolley" title="Footvolley">footvolley</a> emerged in Brazil as variations of football. In martial arts, Brazilians developed <a href="/wiki/Capoeira" title="Capoeira">Capoeira</a>,<sup id="cite_ref-592" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-592">[587]</a></sup> <a href="/wiki/Vale_tudo" class="mw-redirect" title="Vale tudo">Vale tudo</a>,<sup id="cite_ref-593" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-593">[588]</a></sup> and <a href="/wiki/Brazilian_jiu-jitsu" title="Brazilian jiu-jitsu">Brazilian jiu-jitsu</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-594" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-594">[589]</a></sup> </p>
      <p>Brazil has hosted several high-profile international sporting events, like the <a href="/wiki/1950_FIFA_World_Cup" title="1950 FIFA World Cup">1950 FIFA World Cup</a><sup id="cite_ref-595" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-595">[590]</a></sup> and recently has hosted the <a href="/wiki/2014_FIFA_World_Cup" title="2014 FIFA World Cup">2014 FIFA World Cup</a> and <a href="/wiki/2019_Copa_Am%C3%A9rica" title="2019 Copa América">2019 Copa América</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-596" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-596">[591]</a></sup> The <a href="/wiki/S%C3%A3o_Paulo" title="São Paulo">São Paulo</a> circuit, <a href="/wiki/Aut%C3%B3dromo_Jos%C3%A9_Carlos_Pace" class="mw-redirect" title="Autódromo José Carlos Pace">Autódromo José Carlos Pace</a>, hosts the annual <a href="/wiki/Brazilian_Grand_Prix" title="Brazilian Grand Prix">Grand Prix of Brazil</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-597" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-597">[592]</a></sup> São Paulo organized the <a href="/wiki/1963_Pan_American_Games" title="1963 Pan American Games">IV Pan American Games</a> in 1963, and Rio de Janeiro hosted the <a href="/wiki/2007_Pan_American_Games" title="2007 Pan American Games">XV Pan American Games</a> in 2007.<sup id="cite_ref-LiMacIntosh2011_598-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-LiMacIntosh2011-598">[593]</a></sup> On 2 October 2009, Rio de Janeiro was selected to host the <a href="/wiki/2016_Summer_Olympics" title="2016 Summer Olympics">2016 Olympic Games</a> and <a href="/wiki/2016_Summer_Paralympics" title="2016 Summer Paralympics">2016 Paralympic Games</a>, making it the first South American city to host the games<sup id="cite_ref-guardian_olympics_599-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-guardian_olympics-599">[594]</a></sup> and second in Latin America, after <a href="/wiki/Mexico_City" title="Mexico City">Mexico City</a>. Furthermore, the country hosted the <a href="/wiki/FIBA_Basketball_World_Cup" title="FIBA Basketball World Cup">FIBA Basketball World Cups</a> in <a href="/wiki/1954_FIBA_World_Championship" title="1954 FIBA World Championship">1954</a> and <a href="/wiki/1963_FIBA_World_Championship" title="1963 FIBA World Championship">1963</a>. At the 1963 event, the <a href="/wiki/Brazil_national_basketball_team" class="mw-redirect" title="Brazil national basketball team">Brazil national basketball team</a> won one of its two world championship titles.<sup id="cite_ref-FIBA_History_600-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-FIBA_History-600">[595]</a></sup> </p> 
      <div class="thumb tleft">
       <div class="thumbinner" style="width:222px;">
        <a href="/wiki/File:Brasil_conquista_primeiro_ouro_ol%C3%ADmpico_nos_penaltis_1039264-20082016-_mg_4348.jpg" class="image"><img alt="" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/9/9e/Brasil_conquista_primeiro_ouro_ol%C3%ADmpico_nos_penaltis_1039264-20082016-_mg_4348.jpg/220px-Brasil_conquista_primeiro_ouro_ol%C3%ADmpico_nos_penaltis_1039264-20082016-_mg_4348.jpg" decoding="async" width="220" height="147" class="thumbimage" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/9/9e/Brasil_conquista_primeiro_ouro_ol%C3%ADmpico_nos_penaltis_1039264-20082016-_mg_4348.jpg/330px-Brasil_conquista_primeiro_ouro_ol%C3%ADmpico_nos_penaltis_1039264-20082016-_mg_4348.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/9/9e/Brasil_conquista_primeiro_ouro_ol%C3%ADmpico_nos_penaltis_1039264-20082016-_mg_4348.jpg/440px-Brasil_conquista_primeiro_ouro_ol%C3%ADmpico_nos_penaltis_1039264-20082016-_mg_4348.jpg 2x" data-file-width="3800" data-file-height="2533"></a> 
        <div class="thumbcaption">
         <div class="magnify">
          <a href="/wiki/File:Brasil_conquista_primeiro_ouro_ol%C3%ADmpico_nos_penaltis_1039264-20082016-_mg_4348.jpg" class="internal" title="Enlarge"></a>
         </div>Players at the podium with the first <a href="/wiki/Olympic_medal" title="Olympic medal">Olympic Gold</a> of the <a href="/wiki/Brazil_national_football_team" title="Brazil national football team">Brazil national football team</a>, won in the <a href="/wiki/Football_at_the_2016_Summer_Olympics_%E2%80%93_Men%27s_tournament" title="Football at the 2016 Summer Olympics – Men's tournament">2016 Summer Olympics</a>. <a href="/wiki/Association_football" title="Association football">Football</a> is the most popular sport in the country.
        </div>
       </div>
      </div> 
      <p>Some of the most famous athletes in the history of Brazil are: <a href="/wiki/C%C3%A9sar_Cielo" title="César Cielo">César Cielo</a>, <a href="/wiki/Ricardo_Prado" title="Ricardo Prado">Ricardo Prado</a>, <a href="/wiki/Gustavo_Borges" title="Gustavo Borges">Gustavo Borges</a> and <a href="/wiki/Ana_Marcela_Cunha" title="Ana Marcela Cunha">Ana Marcela Cunha</a> in swimming; <a href="/wiki/Maria_Esther_Bueno" class="mw-redirect" title="Maria Esther Bueno">Maria Esther Bueno</a>, <a href="/wiki/Gustavo_Kuerten" title="Gustavo Kuerten">Gustavo Kuerten</a>, <a href="/wiki/Marcelo_Melo" title="Marcelo Melo">Marcelo Melo</a> and <a href="/wiki/Bruno_Soares" title="Bruno Soares">Bruno Soares</a> in tennis; <a href="/wiki/Ayrton_Senna" title="Ayrton Senna">Ayrton Senna</a>, <a href="/wiki/Emerson_Fittipaldi" title="Emerson Fittipaldi">Emerson Fittipaldi</a>, <a href="/wiki/Rubens_Barrichello" title="Rubens Barrichello">Rubens Barrichello</a>, <a href="/wiki/Nelson_Piquet" title="Nelson Piquet">Nelson Piquet</a> and <a href="/wiki/Felipe_Massa" title="Felipe Massa">Felipe Massa</a> in <a href="/wiki/Formula_1" class="mw-redirect" title="Formula 1">Formula 1</a>; <a href="/wiki/Oscar_Schmidt" title="Oscar Schmidt">Oscar Schmidt</a> and <a href="/wiki/Hort%C3%AAncia_Marcari" title="Hortência Marcari">Hortência Marcari</a> in basketball; <a href="/wiki/Torben_Grael" title="Torben Grael">Torben Grael</a> and <a href="/wiki/Robert_Scheidt" title="Robert Scheidt">Robert Scheidt</a> in <a href="/wiki/Sailing" title="Sailing">sailing</a>; <a href="/wiki/Arthur_Zanetti" title="Arthur Zanetti">Arthur Zanetti</a> in <a href="/wiki/Artistic_gymnastics" title="Artistic gymnastics">artistic gymnastics</a>; <a href="/wiki/%C3%89der_Jofre" title="Éder Jofre">Éder Jofre</a> and <a href="/wiki/Acelino_Freitas" title="Acelino Freitas">Acelino Freitas</a> in boxing; <a href="/wiki/Adhemar_Ferreira_da_Silva" class="mw-redirect" title="Adhemar Ferreira da Silva">Adhemar Ferreira da Silva</a>, <a href="/wiki/Joaquim_Cruz" title="Joaquim Cruz">Joaquim Cruz</a>, <a href="/wiki/Maurren_Maggi" title="Maurren Maggi">Maurren Maggi</a> in <a href="/wiki/Track_and_field" title="Track and field">athletics</a>; <a href="/wiki/Rodrigo_Pessoa" title="Rodrigo Pessoa">Rodrigo Pessoa</a> in <a href="/wiki/List_of_equestrian_sports" title="List of equestrian sports">equestrian</a>; <a href="/wiki/Aur%C3%A9lio_Miguel" title="Aurélio Miguel">Aurélio Miguel</a>, <a href="/wiki/Sarah_Menezes" title="Sarah Menezes">Sarah Menezes</a> and <a href="/wiki/Rog%C3%A9rio_Sampaio" title="Rogério Sampaio">Rogério Sampaio</a> in judo; <a href="/wiki/Isaquias_Queiroz" title="Isaquias Queiroz">Isaquias Queiroz</a> in <a href="/wiki/Canoeing" title="Canoeing">canoeing</a>; <a href="/wiki/Bob_Burnquist" title="Bob Burnquist">Bob Burnquist</a> and <a href="/wiki/Sandro_Dias" title="Sandro Dias">Sandro Dias</a> in skateboard; <a href="/wiki/Falc%C3%A3o_(futsal_player)" title="Falcão (futsal player)"> Falcão</a> in <a href="/wiki/Futsal" title="Futsal">futsal</a>; <a href="/wiki/Gabriel_Medina" title="Gabriel Medina">Gabriel Medina</a> in surf; <a href="/wiki/Sandra_Pires" title="Sandra Pires">Sandra Pires</a>, <a href="/wiki/Jackie_Silva" title="Jackie Silva">Jackie Silva</a>, <a href="/wiki/Emanuel_Rego" title="Emanuel Rego">Emanuel Rego</a>, <a href="/wiki/Ricardo_Santos_(beach_volleyball)" title="Ricardo Santos (beach volleyball)">Ricardo Santos</a>, <a href="/wiki/Bruno_Oscar_Schmidt" title="Bruno Oscar Schmidt">Bruno Oscar Schmidt</a>, <a href="/wiki/Alison_Cerutti" title="Alison Cerutti">Alison Cerutti</a> in beach volleyball; <a href="/wiki/Anderson_Silva" title="Anderson Silva">Anderson Silva</a>, <a href="/wiki/Jos%C3%A9_Aldo" title="José Aldo">José Aldo</a>, <a href="/wiki/Ant%C3%B4nio_Rodrigo_Nogueira" title="Antônio Rodrigo Nogueira"> Rodrigo Minotauro</a>, <a href="/wiki/Vitor_Belfort" title="Vitor Belfort">Vitor Belfort</a>, <a href="/wiki/Lyoto_Machida" title="Lyoto Machida">Lyoto Machida</a>, <a href="/wiki/Royce_Gracie" title="Royce Gracie">Royce Gracie</a>, <a href="/wiki/Amanda_Nunes" title="Amanda Nunes">Amanda Nunes</a> in <a href="/wiki/Mixed_martial_arts" title="Mixed martial arts"> MMA</a>. </p>
      <p>Until the 2016 Olympic Games, Brazil had won 129 medals in the history of the Olympic Games, all in the summer editions. There are 30 gold, 36 silver and 63 bronze medals, making it the South American country with the best record in modern Olympic Games history and the 4th largest winner of the Americas behind only the United States, Canada and Cuba, respectively. It's also one of the few countries to have an athlete who received the <a href="/wiki/Pierre_de_Coubertin_medal" title="Pierre de Coubertin medal">Pierre de Coubertin medal</a>: <a href="/wiki/Vanderlei_Cordeiro_de_Lima" class="mw-redirect" title="Vanderlei Cordeiro de Lima">Vanderlei Cordeiro de Lima</a>. The country has already won Olympic <a href="/wiki/Gold_medals" class="mw-redirect" title="Gold medals">gold medals</a> in 11 different sports: sailing, athletics, volleyball, judo, beach volleyball, soccer, swimming, shooting, gymnastics, boxing and equestrian.<sup id="cite_ref-601" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-601">[596]</a></sup> </p> 
      <h3><span class="mw-headline" id="National_holidays">National holidays</span></h3> 
      <table class="wikitable"> 
       <tbody>
        <tr> 
         <th>Date</th> 
         <th>Local name</th> 
         <th>Name</th> 
         <th>Observation </th>
        </tr> 
        <tr> 
         <td>1 January</td> 
         <td>Confraternização Universal</td> 
         <td><a href="/wiki/New_Year%27s_Day" title="New Year's Day">New Year's Day</a></td> 
         <td>Beginning of the calendar year </td>
        </tr> 
        <tr> 
         <td>21 April</td> 
         <td>Tiradentes</td> 
         <td><a href="/wiki/Tiradentes" title="Tiradentes">Tiradentes</a></td> 
         <td>In honor of the martyr of the <a href="/wiki/Minas_Conspiracy" class="mw-redirect" title="Minas Conspiracy">Minas Conspiracy</a> </td>
        </tr> 
        <tr> 
         <td>1 May</td> 
         <td>Dia do Trabalhador</td> 
         <td><a href="/wiki/Labor_Day" title="Labor Day">Labor Day</a></td> 
         <td>Tribute to all workers </td>
        </tr> 
        <tr> 
         <td>7 September</td> 
         <td>Independência</td> 
         <td><a href="/wiki/Independence_of_Brazil" title="Independence of Brazil">Independence of Brazil</a></td> 
         <td>Proclamation of Independence from Portugal </td>
        </tr> 
        <tr> 
         <td>12 October</td> 
         <td>Nossa Senhora Aparecida</td> 
         <td><a href="/wiki/Our_Lady_of_Aparecida" title="Our Lady of Aparecida">Our Lady of Aparecida</a></td> 
         <td><a href="/wiki/Patroness" class="mw-redirect" title="Patroness">Patroness</a> of Brazil </td>
        </tr> 
        <tr> 
         <td>2 November</td> 
         <td>Finados</td> 
         <td><a href="/wiki/All_Souls%27_Day" title="All Souls' Day">All Souls' Day</a></td> 
         <td>Day of remembrance for the dead </td>
        </tr> 
        <tr> 
         <td>15 November</td> 
         <td>Proclamação da República</td> 
         <td>Proclamation of the Republic</td> 
         <td>Transformation of <a href="/wiki/Empire_of_Brazil" title="Empire of Brazil">Empire</a> into <a href="/wiki/First_Brazilian_Republic" title="First Brazilian Republic">Republic</a> </td>
        </tr> 
        <tr> 
         <td>25 December</td> 
         <td>Natal</td> 
         <td>Christmas</td> 
         <td>Traditional Christmas celebration </td>
        </tr>
       </tbody>
      </table>

         <li id="cite_note-Constituição-22"><span class="mw-cite-backlink">^ <a href="#cite_ref-Constituição_22-0"><sup><i><b>a</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-Constituição_22-1"><sup><i><b>b</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-Constituição_22-2"><sup><i><b>c</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-Constituição_22-3"><sup><i><b>d</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-Constituição_22-4"><sup><i><b>e</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-Constituição_22-5"><sup><i><b>f</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-Constituição_22-6"><sup><i><b>g</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-Constituição_22-7"><sup><i><b>h</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-Constituição_22-8"><sup><i><b>i</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-Constituição_22-9"><sup><i><b>j</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-Constituição_22-10"><sup><i><b>k</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-Constituição_22-11"><sup><i><b>l</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-Constituição_22-12"><sup><i><b>m</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-Constituição_22-13"><sup><i><b>n</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-Constituição_22-14"><sup><i><b>o</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-Constituição_22-15"><sup><i><b>p</b></i></sup></a></span> <span class="reference-text">
           <link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r999302996"><cite class="citation web cs1"><a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="http://www.planalto.gov.br/ccivil_03/Constituicao/Constituiçao.htm">"Brazilian Federal Constitution"</a> (in Portuguese).          <li id="cite_note-212"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-212">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">

         <li id="cite_note-256"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-256">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">Georges D.          <li id="cite_note-ODI1-257"><span class="mw-cite-backlink">^ <a href="#cite_ref-ODI1_257-0"><sup><i><b>a</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-ODI1_257-1"><sup><i><b>b</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-ODI1_257-2"><sup><i><b>c</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-ODI1_257-3"><sup><i><b>d</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-ODI1_257-4"><sup><i><b>e</b></i></sup></a></span> <span class="reference-text">Cabral and Weinstock 2010. <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="http://www.odi.org.uk/resources/details.asp?id=5120&amp;title=brazil-election-emerging-donor-aid">Brazil: an emerging aid player</a> (<a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://web.archive.org/web/20110113185641/http://www.odi.org.uk/resources/details.asp?id=5120&amp;title=brazil-election-emerging-donor-aid">Archived</a> 13 January 2011 at the <a href="/wiki/Wayback_Machine" title="Wayback Machine">Wayback Machine</a>).          <li id="cite_note-258"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-258">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">Cabral, Lidia 2010. <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="http://blogs.odi.org.uk/blogs/main/archive/2010/07/22/brazil_south_south_cooperation.aspx">Brazil's development cooperation with the South: a global model in waiting</a> (<a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://web.archive.org/web/20110430190841/http://blogs.odi.org.uk/blogs/main/archive/2010/07/22/brazil_south_south_cooperation.aspx">Archived</a> 30 April 2011 at the <a href="/wiki/Wayback_Machine" title="Wayback Machine">Wayback Machine</a>).            <link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r999302996"><cite id="CITEREFBaigGoldfajn2000" class="citation conference cs1">Baig, Taimur; Goldfajn, Ilan (2000). <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="http://www.imf.org/external/pubs/ft/wp/2000/wp00160.pdf">"The Russian default and the contagion to Brazil"</a> <span class="cs1-format">(PDF)</span>. <i>IMF Working Paper</i>.          <li id="cite_note-348"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-348">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">

         <li id="cite_note-366"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-366">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">

         <li id="cite_note-456"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-456">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">2008 PNAD, IBGE. "<a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://web.archive.org/web/20110614225239/http://www.sidra.ibge.gov.br/bda/tabela/protabl.asp?c=262&amp;i=P&amp;nome=on&amp;notarodape=on&amp;tab=262&amp;unit=0&amp;pov=3&amp;opc1=1&amp;poc2=1&amp;OpcTipoNivt=1&amp;opn1=2&amp;nivt=0&amp;orc86=3&amp;poc1=1&amp;orp=6&amp;qtu3=27&amp;opv=1&amp;poc86=2&amp;sec1=0&amp;opc2=1&amp;pop=1&amp;opn2=0&amp;orv=2&amp;orc2=5&amp;qtu2=5&amp;sev=93&amp;sev=1000093&amp;opc86=1&amp;sec2=0&amp;opp=1&amp;opn3=0&amp;sec86=0&amp;sec86=2776&amp;sec86=2777&amp;sec86=2779&amp;sec86=2778&amp;sec86=2780&amp;sec86=2781&amp;ascendente=on&amp;sep=43344&amp;orn=1&amp;qtu7=9&amp;orc1=4&amp;qtu1=1&amp;cabec=on&amp;pon=1&amp;OpcCara=44&amp;proc=1&amp;opn7=0&amp;decm=99">População residente por cor ou raça, situação e sexo</a>."</span> </li>

         <li id="cite_note-alvaro.com.br-472"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-alvaro.com.br_472-0">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">
           <link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r999302996"><cite id="CITEREFDe_Assis_PoiaresDe_Sá_OsorioSpanholColtre2010" class="citation journal cs1">De Assis Poiares, Lilian; De Sá Osorio, Paulo; Spanhol, Fábio Alexandre; Coltre, Sidnei César; Rodenbusch, Rodrigo; Gusmão, Leonor; Largura, Alvaro; Sandrini, Fabiano; Da Silva, Cláudia Maria Dornelles (2010). <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://www.webcitation.org/5xmleMZgv?url=http://www.alvaro.com.br/pdf/trabalhoCientifico/ARTIGO_BRASIL_LILIAN.pdf">"Allele frequencies of 15 STRs in a representative sample of the Brazilian population"</a> <span class="cs1-format">(PDF)</span>. <i>Forensic Science International: Genetics</i>. <b>4</b> (2): e61–63. <a href="/wiki/Doi_(identifier)" class="mw-redirect" title="Doi (identifier)">doi</a>:<a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://doi.org/10.1016%2Fj.fsigen.2009.05.006">10.1016/j.fsigen.2009.05.006</a>. <a href="/wiki/PMID_(identifier)" class="mw-redirect" title="PMID (identifier)">PMID</a>&nbsp;<a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="//pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/20129458">20129458</a>. Archived from <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="http://www.alvaro.com.br/pdf/trabalhoCientifico/ARTIGO_BRASIL_LILIAN.pdf">the original</a> <span class="cs1-format">(PDF)</span> on 8 April 2011.</cite><span title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Ajournal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=Forensic+Science+International%3A+Genetics&amp;rft.atitle=Allele+frequencies+of+15+STRs+in+a+representative+sample+of+the+Brazilian+population&amp;rft.volume=4&amp;rft.issue=2&amp;rft.pages=e61-63&amp;rft.date=2010&amp;rft_id=info%3Adoi%2F10.1016%2Fj.fsigen.2009.05.006&amp;rft_id=info%3Apmid%2F20129458&amp;rft.aulast=De+Assis+Poiares&amp;rft.aufirst=Lilian&amp;rft.au=De+S%C3%A1+Osorio%2C+Paulo&amp;rft.au=Spanhol%2C+F%C3%A1bio+Alexandre&amp;rft.au=Coltre%2C+Sidnei+C%C3%A9sar&amp;rft.au=Rodenbusch%2C+Rodrigo&amp;rft.au=Gusm%C3%A3o%2C+Leonor&amp;rft.au=Largura%2C+Alvaro&amp;rft.au=Sandrini%2C+Fabiano&amp;rft.au=Da+Silva%2C+Cl%C3%A1udia+Maria+Dornelles&amp;rft_id=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.alvaro.com.br%2Fpdf%2FtrabalhoCientifico%2FARTIGO_BRASIL_LILIAN.pdf&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3ABrazil" class="Z3988"></span></span> </li> 
         <li id="cite_note-www1.folha.uol.com.br-473"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-www1.folha.uol.com.br_473-0">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="http://www1.folha.uol.com.br/folha/ciencia/ult306u633465.shtml">Brazilian DNA is nearly 80% European, indicates study</a>.</span> </li> 
         <li id="cite_note-bdtd.bce.unb.br-474"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-bdtd.bce.unb.br_474-0">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">NMO Godinho <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="http://bdtd.bce.unb.br/tedesimplificado/tde_busca/arquivo.php?codArquivo=3873">O impacto das migrações na constituição genética de populações latino-americanas</a> <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://web.archive.org/web/20110706162240/http://bdtd.bce.unb.br/tedesimplificado/tde_busca/arquivo.php?codArquivo=3873">Archived</a> 6 July 2011 at the <a href="/wiki/Wayback_Machine" title="Wayback Machine">Wayback Machine</a>.          <li id="cite_note-Russo2011-521"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-Russo2011_521-0">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">
           <link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r999302996"><cite id="CITEREFCharles_J._Russo2011" class="citation book cs1">Charles J. Russo (2011). <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://books.google.com/books?id=JuV1cZ7NJHIC&amp;pg=PA45"><i>The Legal Rights of Students with Disabilities: International Perspectives</i></a>. Rowman &amp; Littlefield Publishers. p.&nbsp;45. <a href="/wiki/ISBN_(identifier)" class="mw-redirect" title="ISBN (identifier)">ISBN</a>&nbsp;<a href="/wiki/Special:BookSources/978-1-4422-1085-1" title="Special:BookSources/978-1-4422-1085-1"><bdi>978-1-4422-1085-1</bdi></a>.</cite><span title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook&amp;rft.genre=book&amp;rft.btitle=The+Legal+Rights+of+Students+with+Disabilities%3A+International+Perspectives&amp;rft.pages=45&amp;rft.pub=Rowman+%26+Littlefield+Publishers&amp;rft.date=2011&amp;rft.isbn=978-1-4422-1085-1&amp;rft.au=Charles+J.+Russo&amp;rft_id=https%3A%2F%2Fbooks.google.com%2Fbooks%3Fid%3DJuV1cZ7NJHIC%26pg%3DPA45&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3ABrazil" class="Z3988"></span></span> </li> 
         <li id="cite_note-522"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-522">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">
           <link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r999302996"><cite id="CITEREFCampbellGrondonaMuysken2012" class="citation book cs1">Campbell, Lyle; Grondona, Verónica; Muysken, Peter (2012). "Contacts between indigenous languages in South America". <i>The Indigenous Languages of South America: A Comprehensive Guide</i>. Walter de Gruyter. p.&nbsp;247. <a href="/wiki/ISBN_(identifier)" class="mw-redirect" title="ISBN (identifier)">ISBN</a>&nbsp;<a href="/wiki/Special:BookSources/978-3-11-025803-5" title="Special:BookSources/978-3-11-025803-5"><bdi>978-3-11-025803-5</bdi></a>. <q>Nheengatú (also called língua geral of Amazonia, or lingua Brasilica) originated in the 17th century in what are now the states of Pará Maranhão, as lingua franca on the basis of Tupinambá lexicon but with strong grammatical influence from Portuguese, also due to intervention by Jesuit missionaries [...] Around 1700 it was spoken in a large area in Brazil, as a contact language between whites and indians, but it lost some support with the expulsion of the Jesuits in 1758 [...] Its sister language in the colonial period was Língua Geral Paulista (in the state of São Paolo) a lingua franca which is now extinct.</q></cite><span title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook&amp;rft.genre=bookitem&amp;rft.atitle=Contacts+between+indigenous+languages+in+South+America&amp;rft.btitle=The+Indigenous+Languages+of+South+America%3A+A+Comprehensive+Guide&amp;rft.pages=247&amp;rft.pub=Walter+de+Gruyter&amp;rft.date=2012&amp;rft.isbn=978-3-11-025803-5&amp;rft.aulast=Campbell&amp;rft.aufirst=Lyle&amp;rft.au=Grondona%2C+Ver%C3%B3nica&amp;rft.au=Muysken%2C+Peter&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3ABrazil" class="Z3988"></span></span> </li>

           <link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r999302996"><cite id="CITEREFTeresa_A._Meade2009" class="citation book cs1">Teresa A.          <li id="cite_note-Levinson1998-531"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-Levinson1998_531-0">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">
           <link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r999302996"><cite id="CITEREFDavid_Levinson1998" class="citation book cs1">David Levinson (1998). <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://books.google.com/books?id=uwi-rv3VV6cC&amp;pg=PA325"><i>Ethnic Groups Worldwide: A Ready Reference Handbook</i></a>.          <li id="cite_note-MacGowanPessanha1998-550"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-MacGowanPessanha1998_550-0">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">

         <li id="cite_note-FOOTNOTEMacGowanPessanha1998[httpsbooksgooglecombooksid7MFD-EoTR7MCpgPA6_6]-551"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-FOOTNOTEMacGowanPessanha1998[httpsbooksgooglecombooksid7MFD-EoTR7MCpgPA6_6]_551-0">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><a href="#CITEREFMacGowanPessanha1998">MacGowan &amp; Pessanha (1998)</a>, p.&nbsp;<a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://books.google.com/books?id=7MFD-EoTR7MC&amp;pg=PA6">6</a>.</span> </li>

         <li id="cite_note-FIBA_History-600"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-FIBA_History_600-0">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">
           <link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r999302996"><cite class="citation web cs1"><a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="http://www.fiba.com/downloads/v3_abouFiba/mp/FIBA_world_championships_history.pdf">"FIBA World Championship History (pdf)"</a> <span class="cs1-format">(PDF)</span>. <a href="/wiki/FIBA" title="FIBA">FIBA</a>. 1 January 2007<span class="reference-accessdate">. Retrieved <span class="nowrap">24 February</span> 2012</span>.</cite><span title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook&amp;rft.genre=unknown&amp;rft.btitle=FIBA+World+Championship+History+%28pdf%29&amp;rft.pub=FIBA&amp;rft.date=2007-01-01&amp;rft_id=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.fiba.com%2Fdownloads%2Fv3_abouFiba%2Fmp%2FFIBA_world_championships_history.pdf&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3ABrazil" class="Z3988"></span></span> </li> 
         <li id="cite_note-601"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-601">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://www.olimpiadatododia.com.br/os-olimpicos/240366-curiosidades-das-medalhas-olimpicas-brasileiras/">Brasil at Olympics</a></span> </li> 
        </ol>
       </div>

        <li>Levine, Robert M. <i>Historical Dictionary of Brazil</i> (2019)</li>

               </div></td>

                  <a href="/wiki/File:Gnome-globe.svg" class="image"><img alt="Gnome-globe.svg" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/f/f3/Gnome-globe.svg/25px-Gnome-globe.svg.png" decoding="async" width="25" height="25" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/f/f3/Gnome-globe.svg/38px-Gnome-globe.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/f/f3/Gnome-globe.svg/50px-Gnome-globe.svg.png 2x" data-file-width="48" data-file-height="48"></a><span class="nowrap">&nbsp;</span>Geographic locale

                 <div style="padding:0px"> 
                  <p><b><a href="/wiki/Geographic_coordinate_system" title="Geographic coordinate system">Lat. <span style="font-size:85%;">and</span> Long.</a> 
                    <link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r994658806"><span class="plainlinks nourlexpansion"><a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="//geohack.toolforge.org/geohack.php?pagename=Brazil&amp;params=15_45_S_47_57_W_"><span class="geo-default"><span class="geo-dms" title="Maps, aerial photos, and other data for this location"><span class="latitude">15°45′S</span> <span class="longitude">47°57′W</span></span></span><span class="geo-multi-punct">﻿ / ﻿</span><span class="geo-nondefault"><span class="geo-dec" title="Maps, aerial photos, and other data for this location">15.750°S 47.950°W</span><span style="display:none">﻿ / <span class="geo">-15.750; -47.950</span></span></span></a></span> <span style="color:darkblue">(Brasilia)</span></b> </p> 
                  <div role="navigation" class="navbox" aria-labelledby="Countries_and_dependencies_of_South_America" style="padding:3px">

                      <th scope="row" class="navbox-group" style="width:1%">Organization</th>
                      <td class="navbox-list navbox-odd" style="text-align:left;border-left-width:2px;border-left-style:solid;width:100%;padding:0px">
                       <div style="padding:0em 0.25em"> 
                        <ul>
                         <li><a href="/wiki/Executive_Secretary_of_the_Community_of_Portuguese_Language_Countries" title="Executive Secretary of the Community of Portuguese Language Countries">Executive Secretariat</a></li> 
                         <li><a href="/wiki/Flag_of_the_Community_of_Portuguese_Language_Countries" title="Flag of the Community of Portuguese Language Countries">Flag of the CPLP</a></li> 
                         <li><a href="/wiki/CPLP_Games" title="CPLP Games">CPLP Games</a></li>
                        </ul> 
                       </div></td>
                     </tr>
                     <tr>

                     <tr>
                      <th scope="row" class="navbox-group" style="width:1%"><a href="/wiki/Member_states_of_the_Organization_of_American_States" title="Member states of the Organization of American States">Members</a></th>
                      <td class="navbox-list navbox-odd" style="text-align:left;border-left-width:2px;border-left-style:solid;width:100%;padding:0px">
                       <div style="padding:0em 0.25em"></div>
                       <table class="nowraplinks navbox-subgroup" style="border-spacing:0">
                        <tbody>
                         <tr>
                          <td colspan="2" class="navbox-list navbox-odd" style="width:100%;padding:0px">
                           <div style="padding:0em 0.25em">

                         <li><a href="/wiki/4th_BRICS_summit" title="4th BRICS summit">New Delhi 2012</a></li> 
                         <li><a href="/wiki/5th_BRICS_summit" title="5th BRICS summit">Durban 2013</a></li> 
                         <li><a href="/wiki/6th_BRICS_summit" title="6th BRICS summit">Fortaleza 2014</a></li> 
                         <li><a href="/wiki/7th_BRICS_summit" title="7th BRICS summit">Ufa 2015</a></li> 
                         <li><a href="/wiki/8th_BRICS_summit" title="8th BRICS summit">Goa 2016</a></li> 
                         <li><a href="/wiki/9th_BRICS_summit" title="9th BRICS summit">Xiamen 2017</a></li> 
                         <li><a href="/wiki/10th_BRICS_summit" title="10th BRICS summit">Johannesburg 2018</a></li> 
                         <li><a href="/wiki/11th_BRICS_summit" title="11th BRICS summit">Brasília 2019</a></li> 
                         <li><a href="/wiki/12th_BRICS_summit" title="12th BRICS summit">Saint Petersburg 2020</a></li>
                        </ul> 
                       </div></td>
                     </tr>
                     <tr>
                      <th scope="row" class="navbox-group" style="width:1%"><a href="/wiki/Bilateralism" title="Bilateralism">Bilateral relations</a></th>
